title: Reclaiming People-Centred Development in an Age of Retrogression: Reflections on Doha Summit
content: During the World Summit for Social Development in Doha, discussions unfolded with a mix of hope, urgency, and unease.
creator: Philip Nalangan

title: Call for Participants for Young Scholars Workshop: Feminist Approaches to Macroeconomic Policy in East Africa
content: Call for Participants for the Young Scholars Workshop on "Feminist Approaches to Macroeconomic Policy in East Africa".
creator: Philip Nalangan

title: Economic Dogma Blocks Pragmatic Policies
content: After condemning pragmatic responses to the 1997-98 Asian financial crises, the West pursued similar policies in response to the 2008 global financial crisis without acknowledging its own mistakes.
creator: Philip Nalangan

title: The Fairy Dust of Digitalisation: Why Tech Won’t Deliver Social Development
content: One issue remained conspicuously absent from the WSSD II: the unequal distribution of power in the global economy.
creator: Philip Nalangan

title: China’s Trade Relations Need Reform
content: China’s export growth and record trade surplus, in a year when it has been partially shut out from US markets, signal the need to seek greater balance in its trade with other nations.
creator: Philip Nalangan
